if it's a bit bigger you can put it in a

I think it's it's very important for the
data field um partly it's because um you
know I see this in discussions of

they say oh we haven't actually launched

future and uh my number one advice to
them then is then actually don't worry
about scalability because what you want
to optimize for at the early stage very
much is at making things easy to change
so just Implement things in the simplest
way that will possibly work but that
allows you to modify it easily and adapt
to what you learn about the market about
your users and so on um and that often
means choosing general purpose
Technologies and so for example you know
just using a relational database will
get you pretty far I think uh and it's
actually pretty good for evolution you
know you can add more tables to it you
can add indexes you can drop indexes you
can evolve the schema as as needed or by
all means you know use it document
database if that's more like your your
preference but if those things are more
or less converging anyway is my feeling
um and and those things allow you know
maybe not for scale to billions of users
but they will allow you to evolve things
easily and then later on once you learn
what what you need to what features you
need in order for your system to be
popular only then will you know what are
the features that putting a lot of load
on your data system systems and only
then will you be able to engineer them
in such a way that they scale well for
that particular workload but you can't
really do that scalability work before
you know what the workload is going to
be and you don't know what the workload
is until you have a lot of people using
it uh and large amounts of data and so I
feel that uh there's like almost this
trade-off between ease of change and
scalability where systems that are
highly scalable are often very difficult
to change because you baked in
assumptions about how the what
operations are going to be common and
which going to be uncommon for example
they get baked in at a very fundamental
level in the architecture whereas A
system that is easy to change and
general purpose uh is often more
difficult to scale so I think that's
that's quite an important trade-off for
people to
consider yeah and since you and I are

distributed pubsub systems where

just add another consumer it's it's

potentially if you want to migrate from

um part of what enables this is what
